column4: I'm trying to install linux-headers but do not know which version I need
What is "On 386" imply?
do I want linux-headers-2.6.12-10 or linux-headers-2.6.12-10-386
sudo aptitude install linux-headers-$(uname -r)
I'm assuming that will install the correct ones automatically?
yes - in fact it will install both of those (-10 depends on -10-386)
Perfect, thank you.
yw :)
Would you recommend I Follow this guide (https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HowToInstallTheWlanNgDriverInHoary) to get my Wireless PCMCIA device working?
oops, btw the dependency is the other way around (not really important but i'm a perfectionist :P )
Gotcha. About the guide?
Do you recommend I follow it?
sorry, i'm not sure, breezy would have additional modules built in (i can see a prism2 module)
actually that's a usb module
I'm in breezy now but I cannot get my PCMCIA wireless device to work correctly, a gooogle search returned this guide
i reckon it's worth a try :)
The drivers that he recommends to download have PCMCIA, usb, ect
okay. Thanks.
note that the kernel numbers have changed (2.6.12 now)
s/numbers/versions/
also, i would use checkinstall instead of "make install"
